Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Nudity \Nu"di*ty\, n.; pl. {Nudities}. [Cf. F. nudit['e].] 1. The quality or state of being nude; nakedness. [1913 Webster]
2. That which is nude or naked; naked part; undraped or unclothed portion; esp. (Fine Arts), the human figure represented unclothed; any representation of nakedness; -- chiefly used in the plural and in a bad sense. [1913 Webster]
There are no such licenses permitted in poetry any more than in painting, to design and color obscene nudities. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
nudity n : the state of being without clothing or covering of any kind [syn: {nakedness}, {nudeness}]
